subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] 2003 European TEX Conference paper discussing Quikskript
msgSnippet: Hello everybody, Could someone explain why my message appeared only 11 h 18 min after I ve sent it? Meanwhile, I ve read David Dailey s answer and downloaded
messageBody:
Hello everybody,

Could someone explain why my message appeared only 11 h 18 min after I've
sent it?

Meanwhile, I've read David Dailey's answer and downloaded the PDF file.

JF


----- Original Message -----
From: "Jean-François Colson" <jfcolson@...>
To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 24, 2005 9:56 AM
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] 2003 European TEX Conference paper discussing
Quikskript


>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Wayne Cornelius" <wayne_cornelius@...>
> To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, March 24, 2005 3:22 AM
> Subject: [Read_Alphabet] 2003 European TEX Conference paper discussing
> Quikskript
>
>
>>
>>
>>
>> Recently received proceedings of EuroTEX 2003 conference. (TEX
>> referring to the scientific document typesetting system, and the
>> participants were members of a User Group of that system) An article
>> on fonts for artificial & synthetic alphabets caught my attention.
>> Unfortunately, I can't read very much of it, since it is written in
>> French.
>
> Send it to me and I'll translate it.
> If you've got a scanner you can send a copy of that document to
> jfcolson@.... That's a 50 MB box.
> Otherwise send it to Jean-François Colson, BP 11, BE-6560 Erquelinnes,
> Belgium.
>
>
>
